revised_title: Enzyme Amygdalase: Separating Glucose from Amygdalin in Yeast
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to study the enzymes in yeast and discovered a specific enzyme, amygdalase, that separates glucose from amygdalin. They found that amygdalase is different from maltase and that yeast contains separate a-glucosidoclasts. This discovery helps to understand the different enzymes present in yeast and their functions.
